title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2401.3 - Appeals
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 2401.3 - Appeals

State Regulations
(a) Any person
denied access to records may, within 30 days, appeal, in writing, such denial
to the president or the designee of the president. (b) The president or the designee of the
president shall, within seven business days, respond to such appeal by: (1)
fully explaining, in writing, the reasons
for further denial of such request; or
(2)
notifying, in writing, of the intention
of the corporation to provide access to the records sought. (c) The president or his designee
shall immediately forward to the records access officer and the Committee on

Open Government a copy of such appeal and the determination thereon. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
ยง
2401.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
